description: The **pagination** component serves as a navigation tool within an application feature or content display that enables the user to step through a sequential list of available pages or result sets in either an increasing and decreasing succession as well as to skip past numerous pages at a time.
name: Pagination
usage:
The Pagination component consists of styled links or buttons, that are aligned side by side. `aria-label` attributes should be used to give more context to each pagination trigger and `aria-current` should be used to mark the current selection. Each HTML element can be removed if not in use. ```html
  • Previous
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5
  • Next
``` The Pagination component also supports rows per page variation where user can specify the number of rows that display on a page by selecting a dropdown. Each HTML element can be removed if not in use. ```html
Showing
50
rows per page
```
